folder.video: Description: A 3D puzzle based game which utilizes NeuroSky BCI technology to allow users to actually move objects within the game with their minds. This game is still in BETA due to Blade 3D being a brand new engine and the fact that BCI interface with gaming is something that has never been attempted thus far. I was the lone programmer in this project. Neurosky Integration: Integrating the NeuroSky device with the Blade3D Game Engine, the coding was mostly done in C# and integration with the Blade 3D game engine required Blade 3D specific syntax. Random Distraction: A random distraction generator with would cycle through 1 random distraction out of 5 per level and trigger when the attention level of the player was raised to a certain point. XML File Generator: For research purposes I was also give the task of programmatically generating an XML file which would hold specific player data during a specific time in order to document when a player was, what is attention level was, and which distract had occurred to trigger a distortion in the players Attention. This was done so that it could be charted in flash for ease of use. Project Team: Craig Stevenson, Arjun Gupta, Peter Stratton, Phil Lyon, Hardik Bhatt, Jeff Lorenz

Description: A game prototype created at Drexel University it is a fast-paced, epic third-person shooter focusing on large-scale "boss" encounters, featuring several phases and play styles for each enemy the main character faces. This prototype was featured at Eurographics '08 in Greece. My task in this game was as a Lead Programmer. Boss AI: I built the AI framework for this game, which is featured in the samples section. Particle effect: Implemented all the partical effects for the game. The eye beam target shooting for the "Owle Boss," moniter beam particles, mini flying owl probes eyebeam particles, and gun shooting particles for the main character. Audio: Implemented all the audio in the game for the "Owle Boss" level Project Team: Alex Serret, Josh Sankey, Jordan Santell, James Borden, Hardik Bhatt, Zachary Brooks, Brittany Tress, Scott Ackerman, Kevin Appel
Description: Create a function called earthquake that simulates an earthquake. It need only shake a single building.
Description: Create a function called quicksand that simulates a building sinking in quicksand.
Description: Create a function called lighthouse that causes a building to rotate (like the light on a lighthouse).

Description: Modify the original Torque code to implement additional features which will be added to improve gameplay. Clone function: Modify the code to create a few player avatar clones. Created a function that moves the clones using keyboard inputs Jump Function: Make the clones jump up and trigger it through keyboard input. Minimize Function: Created a function which would minimize the clones to about half the size of the original, after keyboard input.

Description: Creating all the basics features that make up a game. An inventory list to the player's HUD, background music as well as add localized sound to buildings Timeout: Added tension by imposing a time limit for my game when the time runs out pop up a dialog box that informs the user that the game is over containing an Exit and a Continue button. To prevent the player of being in the dark I added an indicator to the HUD that indicates how much time remains. Inventory: Added an inventory system to keep track of all the items and objects they the player discovers and picks up. The list is updated every time items are added, dropped, or used up Sound: Create a night club or a torture chamber, I essentially wrote a function that plays the songs in sequence. The song will only trigger if the player enters a specific building, the trick is to figure out which is which. In addition to that I also create a positional sound which will dissipate when you move away from the sound. Teleport: Modified the code so that when the user presses the 't' key, the user is teleported to another location in the game world. The player does not have an unlimited number of teleports I set the limit to 10. Enemy Spawning: Randomly spawning 100 enemies around the gaming world.
